gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency
Class Marker

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.Marker
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Marker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is a datastructure for grouping together all of the information necessary for making a marker.

See Also:
MarkerOverlay, Serialized Form

Field Summary
static int BOX
          3 - This is the marker code for drawing a box centered at a specified point.

          4 - This is the marker code for drawing a circle centered at a specified point.

          6 - This is the marker code for drawing a horizontal dash centered at a specified point.

          7 - This is the marker code for drawing a negative sloped dash centered at a specified point.

          12 - This is the marker code for drawing a line angled at 45 degrees with a negative slope (\).

Field Detail

RESIZEABLE

public static final int RESIZEABLE
0 - If you want the marker to resize when zooming takes place, use this variable.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATIC

public static final int STATIC
If you want the marker to maintain a consistent size when zooming takes place, use this variable.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constant Field Values

VLINE

public static final int VLINE
10 - This is the marker code for drawing a vertical line spanning the vertical extents of the image and passing through the specified point. The size specified in the draw() has no affect on this marker.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HLINE

public static final int HLINE
11 - This is the marker code for drawing a horizontal line spanning the horizontal extents of the image and passing through the specified point. The size specified in the draw() has no affect on this marker.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NLINE

public static final int NLINE
12 - This is the marker code for drawing a line angled at 45 degrees with a negative slope (\). The line extends to the bounds of the image. The size specified in the draw() has no affect on this marker.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PLINE

public static final int PLINE
13 - This is the marker code for drawing a line angled at 45 degrees with a positive slope (/). The line extends to the bounds of the image. The size specified in the draw() has no affect on this marker.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Marker

public Marker(int type,
              floatPoint2D[] locales,
              java.awt.Color color,
              float radius,
              int behave_on_zoom)
Constructor for marker class, instance for multiple similar markers.

Parameters:
type - The type of marker desired.
locales - The world coord. location for each marker.
color - The color of all the markers specified by this instance.
radius - The radius of the circle circumscribing the marker in world coordinates.
behave_on_zoom - How the cursor reacts to zooming, either resizes or maintains the same size.

Marker

public Marker(int type,
              floatPoint2D locale,
              java.awt.Color color,
              float radius,
              int behave_on_zoom)
Constructor for marker class, instance for one marker.

Parameters:
type - The type of marker desired.
locale - The world coord. location for each marker.
color - The color of all the markers specified by this instance.
radius - The radius of the circle circumscribing the marker in world coordinates.
behave_on_zoom - How the cursor reacts to zooming, either resizes or maintains the same size.
Method Detail

setCurrentTransform

public void setCurrentTransform(CoordTransform trans)
This method must be called at least once before the draw() routine is used. This transform has pixel bounds as it's source and world bounds as it's destination.

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor()
Set the color of all the markers specified by this instance.

Returns:
The color of the marker.

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
Set the color of all the markers specified by this instance.

Parameters:
color - The color of the markers.

getSize

public float getSize()
The size refers to the radius of the circle circumscribing the marker. This size should be in world coordinates.

Returns:
The radius of the circle circumscribing the marker in world coordinates.

resize

public void resize(float new_size)
The size refers to the radius of the circle circumscribing the marker. This size should be in world coordinates.

Parameters:
new_size - The radius of the circle circumscribing the marker in world coordinates.

getMarkerType

public int getMarkerType()
Get the visual display type of the marker. The marker types are specified by static variables defined in this class.

Returns:
The type of marker to be diplayed.

setMarkerType

public void setMarkerType(int type)
Set the visual display type of the marker. The marker types are specified by static variables defined in this class.

Parameters:
type - The type of marker to be diplayed.

getBehavior

public int getBehavior()
Get how the marker reacts to zooming. Two options are currently supported, resize on zoom (RESIZEABLE) and maintain size on zoom (STATIC).

Returns:
How the marker reacts to zooming.

setBehavior

public void setBehavior(int behave_on_zoom)
Set how the marker reacts to zooming. Two options are currently supported, resize on zoom (RESIZEABLE) and maintain size on zoom (STATIC).

Parameters:
behave_on_zoom - How the marker reacts to zooming.

intCodeToString

public static java.lang.String intCodeToString(int code)
This method is used to quickly convert a marker type int code to its corresponding String representation. Null is returned if

Parameters:
code - The marker type int code, specified by static variables in this class.
Returns:
The String representation of the specified code, null if not found.

stringToIntCode

public static int stringToIntCode(java.lang.String string_rep)
This method is used to quickly convert a marker type String returned by toString() or intCodeToString() to its int code specified by static variables in this class. If string_rep is not found, -1 will be returned.

Parameters:
string_rep - The marker type String, specific to this class.
Returns:
The int code for the marker, -1 if not found.

getStringArray

public static java.lang.String[] getStringArray()
Give the list of possible marker types, represented by Strings. This list is synchronized with the array of marker type int codes, so the index from the string type array can be used to get the int code.

Returns:
The array of marker types expressed as Strings.

getIntCodeArray

public static int[] getIntCodeArray()
Give the list of possible marker types, represented by int codes. This list is synchronized with the array of marker type Strings, so the index from the int code array can be used to get the String.

Returns:
The array of marker types expressed as an int.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
Use this command to draw the markers on the overlay.

Parameters:
g2d - The graphics object where the marker will be drawn..

public java.lang.String toString()
Display the name of the marker.

Returns:
